Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to stadium”
Reviews.Author: Traveller111Usa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The service was good. We asked for lots of towels and blankets, and they accomodated us. The complimentary breakfast was good. The staff was helpful. The rooms were not huge, but comfortable. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. My only issue was, you have to walk through the bedroom to get to the bathroom. If you have someone staying on the pullout couch, which we did, it can be an issue. That seems to be the arrangement in many suite hotels, which I don't tlike. But I do like the way the bathroom sink is in a separate area from the shower and toilet. The kitchen area was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Not as pleased this time”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFunMom
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel after our stay last year for Jamfest Super Nationals Cheer Competition in January. Last year I couldn't have been happier with our stay, this year I could have been a LOT happier. I will start with THE GOOD. To start, we got a great deal. We stayed as a group last year and were able to negotiate a good rate for this year based on that. The room was nice and clean. That is very important to me. In fact, we loved the room. We had a double queen suite with a pull out couch in the living room. Plenty of room for the 4 of us that stayed there. Some in our group had as many as 6 in their rooms and they still felt comfortable. The kitchen with full fridge was a plus. It was perfect for leftovers from the restaurants we visited on our off time. It was nice to have cupboards filled with dishes and we were very happy to find wine glasses and even a wine opener. If you have ever had to spend a full day at the convention center with teenagers and non stop cheerleading, you know how much appreciated a nice glass of wine is when you get back to your hotel! Breakfast was good, too. A nice selection. On Saturday we had to be at the competition so early that we missed breakfast but on Sunday the manager was very helpful and arranged to serve it an hour earlier than normal so we could eat before we left for the day. It was great to fill up before we hit the road back home on Monday, too. The shuttle was a nice convience but it wasn't always running. However, the front desk was always quick to get a cab for us when needed. It was never more than 5 to7 bucks for a trip to any downtown destination. Now, THE BAD To start, we had a group with us. 6 rooms total. We understood we probably wouldn't all be right next door to each other but we requested we be close. They said "they'd try" but we were spread out all over that hotel. Some on 2nd floor. Some on 3rd. Some on 6th. Based on what I saw that weekend in the breakfast room, lobby, elevators, and parking lot they were not fully booked. I think they could have "tried" a little harder to get us at least on the same floor as each other. Second, no maid service on weekends. No new towels, no trash emptied, no clean up, no beds made. If you wanted weekend maid service you had to call before 5 to arrange it, and you'd be charged. With 4 women in one room there was no way we could go three nights with the original set of towels. So, on Saturday (night 2) I called the front desk to ask for more towels and a trash bag since ours was completely overflowing and was barked at "you have to come down here for that!" So, down I went. I had to practically beg for enough towels for us to shower with, they did not want to give them up. And I was told there simply was no more trash bags to give. None. I had two more nights left with trash overflowing in the kitchen and bathroom and they would not give us a trash bag! Each one of my friends (6 rooms worth) all had the exact same problems. One was given hand towels to shower with, one was given dirty towels, and yet another was just told "sorry, no more towels". Nobody ever got a trash bag. Not one over the whole weekend. By Monday when we left we had trash piled all over the place. We used grocery bags and take out bags that we had with us but still, it was bad. And we had to deal with it all weekend since there was no maid to come through and pick it up. Awful. Just awful. One last thing. While we all got a great rate, one person in our group was charged a LOT more than the rest of us and they had no explaination for it. They ended up taking $75 off her bill but that was still nowhere near the deal the rest of us got. When she complained and explained she was part of our group (booked together and everything) the front desk people had a "too bad so sad" attitude. I was sadly disappointed in the Staybridge this trip. And that's unfortunate because last year was such a good experience. With the Super Bowl in Indy this year and Lucas Oil Stadium being just steps away you'd think they'd be on their A game but they really fell flat. I like the Staybridge in general but the lack of towels and trash build up did me in. I'm not sure I'd stay there again. I think if we go back to Jamfest next year I will try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as some other Staybridge I've been in”
Reviews.Author: weyes
Reviews.Content: I was surprised we had to pay for parking on a night when it seemed completely dead downtown in December. The hotel front desk staff was not as friendly as they are at the one in Carmel. Rooms are pretty standard as others. Breakfast was about the same, but not laid out as well and in a smaller area. The seating area was so packed that there were no places to sit. Had a colleague staying here the same night who checked in fairly late and she really had some issues with the staff and billing. Not sure I'd stay here again. Was in town for an event at the Marriott and that was beautiful hotel decorated really nice for Christmas. I would probably stay there if downtown again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but poor management service.”
Reviews.Author: Ngfunky
Reviews.Content: I accidently booked my stay without using points. Called hotel manager several times to work out the situation, but never got a response. Asked to cancel the room, but would not get money back due to advance purchase. So I was stuck with the price and reservation. I was very frustrated that the manager would not even bother to work out my request. This is probably unique to me, but is my key negative experience. Upon arriving to the hotel, I requested a later checkout and was pleasantly surprised that the front desk was willing to accommodate even though I requested this before arriving and was denied twice. Additionally, I was given an upgrade. The room was great, wonderful amenities and clean. The hotel is also super close to Lucas stadium. This means you can also hear the stadium announcements and noises. Parking for hotel is also an extra $12. Summary- Negatives = bad experience with reservation and management unresponsiveness, noisy stadium. Positives = beautiful hotel and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal2004
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Very convenient location near Lucas Oil Stadium and the Indianapolis Convention Center. Also very convenient when getting on/off the freeway. There's parking behind the hotel, but it was often full, so we usually used the complementary parking garage a short distance away. It was great to have the kitchen facilities available in a Staybridge Suites hotel, so it felt like home for the 4 days we were there. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for game day - good for going to the races”
Reviews.Author: greasemonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in late August for a long weekend to attend the Moto GP race at IMS. We lucked out in finally having a Colts preseason game at home that weekend as well. The great - staying here meant walking to the game and not messing with traffic. The good - staying here also meant we could walk to Meridian for food and fun at night. Yes, it was a little bit of walk, but we were not bothered by walking. The okay - this hotel does not have an ice machine for hotel guests to access without going through the front desk. The ice machine in our room didn't produce more than 2 batches of ice each day. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, great for 4 adults to sleep but tight for hanging out in the living area as a group (plus the 2 others staying down the hall). Breakfast was okay, not great. The front desk staff was pretty helpful in answering questions for us. Parking lot behind the hotel was a little tight. The night of the game, we knew that would be an issue and planned for being back from IMS early. You can't deny how awesome it is to have the view of Lucas Oil Stadium outside your room every day. There was no room service on the weekend, which was fine since we were aware of this. I will say that the front desk didn't tell us this, I knew this from reading reviews and reading the sign in the bathroom, however it wasn't a prominent sign and our other party staying here didn't realize that. Would we stay here again? Probably. The cost is a bit high, but we weighed the cost against knowing we were at the stadium and downtown and wouldn't have to mess with parking down there. The drive to IMS is pretty easy and it's in a pretty quiet area of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A Viable Choice For A Colt's Game-Only”
Reviews.Author: enofile1
Reviews.Content: We chose the Staybridge Suites as we were in Indianapolis to watch the Packers defeat the Colts with our small dog & most of the lodging Downtown was sold out. We were given a "dog room" on the 2nd floor for an additional $75 pet fee. I believe the inhabitants of room 211 before us must have "bunked" with a pack of wolves.Not only did the room smell like a sordid kennel, but there were stains every where as witness to past beastly soil. Our little pup was scratching for 3 days & it was difficult to sleep.The suite itself was large,with a kitchenette & nondescript decor.Rooms were "lightly cleaned," & sheets were changed once a week.Cleanliness was not next to godliness.Parking cost 12 bucks & if the lot was filled, you had the privlledge of using a parking structure 2 blocks away.The hotel is only 2 blocks from Lucas Oil Stsdium. That's it's only saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but convenient.”
Reviews.Author: reelfun2132
Reviews.Content: Very Convenient to Lucas Stadium. It's a little pricey for non-event nights though. Room and hotel are clean. Since this is a exteneded stay there is no room service on weekends. Parking is limited especially during events. Here's a tip if you don't stay here: don't pay for parking during events, just park here. They don't enforce it!! We had to park in parking garage a block away. There are no convenient restaraunts in the area. I would stay here again if attending stadium event only.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: RonPittsburgh_PA
Reviews.Content: I have to say this hotel did not live up to it's description. We stayed in one of their "Studio Suites" and I cannot see how they can call it a suite. It was half the size of any other suite I've stayed in, about as long as a Red Roof double room. The layout was terrible, with a lot of space wasted by a full size fridge, dish washer and stove top. I can't imagine anyone bringing enough food with them to cook while on vacation or on a business trip. The couch and bed were perpendicular to the TV so it was not watchable from either. The TV stand had the only drawers and they were blocked by the bed and would not open the whole way. The rooms AC sounded like a tractor trailer every time it started up and woke me multiple times. The breakfast was decent but there were only six tables in the lobby and finding somewhere to sit was very difficult with a full hotel. I would not recommend this place to anyone and will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Something different”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinGroan
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend and at check in, we were told that they do not have housekeeping on weekends (only if you need something, ie extra towels) This was something new to us, but after thinking about it and staying there, it was no problem. If it keeps the cost down, we are all for it. Everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at this chain again”
Reviews.Author: Marie1253449
Reviews.Content: Please beware of what you are told before you stay at this hotel. Every year I meet my family in this area for a three day weekend and the race. This year I came across this hotel on the internet. The pictures were amazing. The full kitchen really looked great. The price was a little high for a two bedroom suite. But I thought it might be a nice treat. I called to get more details. I was sure to have a long talk with the reservation clerk as I need to ensure we were getting one room with two double or queen beds as I have a 71 year old father and a handycapped sister. They require their own beds. I also travel with my husband and two young children so they could stay on the pull out if needed the other room really didn't matter. I was very excited after talking to the clerk that they had a two bedroom suite one room with two queen beds and another with a king as well as a full kitchen. We arrived three hours early and obviously the rooms were not available. When the room was ready we were very excited to see how it looked. What we found was a a two bedroom suite with two king beds and a kitchen that really should not be called a kitchen. It did have a small fridge and mini stove top but looked nothing like the picture. It actually looked other places we had stayed that called it a mini kitchen area. Basically a one bedroom suite with a door left open to another room. I called downstairs as there was no way father and daughter could sleep together and at this point we didn't have enough beds. I was told that I must have made the reservations wrong as it was coded two kings. I explained I had a detailed conversation with the clerk and was told that is not what we have here. So first I was insulted and made to look like I lied. I explained we cannot take this room we didn't have enough beds. After some back and forth I was told we will give you a room across the hall as that is all we have and will take 50.00 off the room for your trouble. Although I was still a unhappy with the situation and being separated from my 71 year old father he felt he would be fine alone and we were getting a discount price which would save him money so we decided to go ahead and agree. The only other complaint I have is the "movie room" this is really just a TV and you have to bring your own movie to watch. I was under the impression from the site that they played disney movies. When I got home I found a 868.00 room charge and a 197.00 room charge. I would like to know who would ever consider paying that much for three nights! Anyway, I called to complain and was told that again I can't hear well and that the front desk clerk did a great job by giving me a 50.00 credit for the second room. If you are reading this I hope you are also reading the review where a plane was late and someone lost their room ever after calling to let them know. You might want to get a noterized document prior to staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: nedlyj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Staybridge for one night while in Indianapolis to visit the Murat Theatre. The hotel is conveniently located, the price was good, and our room was very nice and clean - with a nice kitchenette, which we didn't get a chance to use. I would say the room is a little smaller than expected for a suite. The living area was very small - the sofa was maybe 5 feet from the TV on the wall, so you felt right on top of it with really no room for additional seating around it. However, the bedroom was large, and since it was just the two of us the living room arrangement didn't matter to us. Breakfast was hot and good. The only real downside is parking - if you're there earliy you can be in the lot right behind the hotel, but if you come in later that will be full and you'll end up parking in the garage two buildings down. And parking is an additional $12. But all in all it was a nice overnight stay at the Staybridge.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel - and even better for Colts games”
Reviews.Author: Will-HE_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is obviously only a couple of years old, and everything felt fresh and new. The room was superb - comfy seating area, wonderful bed, spacious bathroom and well equipped bathroom. Unbeatable for the price. The location is incredible for Lucas Oil Stadium - it dominates all the rear-facing windows and literally a minute's walk away. The City Centre is a bit more of a trek - 10-15 mins, and on the far side of the stadium. The walk requires crossing the empty stadium car parks and past a number of businesses, but I didn't feel intimidated - just alone - I can see that others might find it a problem, but I can't imagine the sub-5 minute taxi-ride would cost much.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to stay to see a Colts Game and travel with Kids!”
Reviews.Author: summerb26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to see the Colts game in December and was Wowed by how large the rooms were and how close it was to the Stadium! 5 dollar cab ride to downtown. Stadium literally right out your window, maybe 2 blocks. Rooms are very spacious and the Kitchen was HUGE, I mean it really is like staying in an apartment not a hotel room Very clean! Indoor pool area was very nice as well as the workout room. They also have a theater room that you can watch moviee or t.v. We will definately be returning the next time we are in Indianapolis!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFunMom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Staybridge when my teen daughter's cheer team had a competition at the Indiana Convention Center. We had several families from our team stay here with us. I had never been to Indy before and knew nothing of the city, or this hotel, before my stay. Every person in our group agrees that the Staybridge was excellent in every way. To save money, many of us chose a friend to room with. I am one who likes my space so I was worried about feeling "cooped up" even with a friend I like very much. I shouldn't have worried. The suites were big enough that I never felt cramped. The room itself was very clean. We did a very intense "bedbug check" and were pleased to find the room bug free and extremely clean. The kitchen was wonderful, with beautiful granite counters. We brought lots of food with us and there was plenty of room for it all. We loved the seperate living room so the kids could go to bed early and the grown ups could stay up chatting. The only thing I didn't like is that the bathroom was in the bedroom area so someone who needs to make frequent nighttime bathroom trips may disturb the people sleeping. It made mornings a little more difficult as well. You could not get ready without waking the people who wanted to sleep longer. The lobby was nice and breakfast was really good. They offered your typical items plus a few hot items like scrambled eggs and sausage, or biscuits, or diced potatos. A little different each morning. We liked it and appreciated it on our busy competition mornings. We parked our car on our arrival day and never used it again. They had shuttles running often from any downtown location to the hotel and back. If a shuttle wasn't available the front desk called a cab, which was always there within minutes. Each ran about 5 to 10 bucks per trip, but they were van sized and between us all it was mere dollars per person and much better than driving and paying for parking each time. The shuttle drivers were friendly and knowledgable about the city. We much perferred them over the cab drivers. My daughter and I did not use the pool but our friends did and liked it very much. We were surprised at how close Lucas Oil Stadium was to the hotel. We took pictures from the hallway window and sent them to my son who is a Colts fan. He was big time jealous. Anyone staying here for a Colts game will be thrilled at the location. On our last night we were so tired we decided to order take out and the front desk clerk recommeded a pizza place. I don't remember their name but she was right on. The pizza was delicious! They had a flyer at the front desk with coupons. Use them! You won't be disappointed. Overall, I would recommed this hotel to anyone staying in downtown Indy. We will surely choose this hotel again next year when we return to defend our National title (did I mention my daughter's team won First Place?) at the Jamfest competition. Great hotel, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sassycat46932
Reviews.Content: My husband and his friends stay at this hotel when GenCon comes to Indianapolis and he was always satisfied with it. When I found out that the Titanic exhibit would be coming to the Indiana State Museum around the time of our first anniversary, because of my husband's recommendations and past experiences with this hotel, we immediately booked a room for one night. When we arrived, I was surprised at how nice the lobby looked. It was very well decorated and furnished. Our room was beautiful (although we didn't get the view of the stadium--perfectly okay anyway!) and although somewhat smallish, perfect for two people. We had a kitchenette, complete with sinks, a refrigerator, microwave and dishwasher. I don't recall there being a stove, but I'm not sure if they were supplied in the smaller rooms. My husband and I also made good use of the pool and hot tub. The hot tub was set for a relaxing temperature. The facilities were clean and well-stocked with towels. The bed was quite nice and comfortable. I'm not one to sleep well in strange places, so I woke up somewhat often, but it was no fault of the quality of the bed. (Just a personal side note--I really enjoyed the style of the bedspread!) Also, the hotel is a great walking distance away from the stadium, Convention Center, the Indiana State Museum and the White River State Park. Even though we had checked out by eleven, we had tickets to the Titanic exhibit at noon but didn't want to have to drive there and pay for parking. The hotel staff was kind enough to let us leave our car in the parking lot while we were at the museum. It was an overall great experience and would definitely book a night at this hotel again if the occasion arises!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pdt1973
Reviews.Content: I spent about nine weeks at this location. The Management and staff continually showed excellent customer service and concern for the guests. I would with good conscience recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: komets1032
Reviews.Content: Me and my family went to a Colts game in Indianapolisfor Chrismas. Our hotel had EVERYTHING that we would need. Theyhad a stove, dishes, kitchen sink, FULL sized fridge, controlled heat, a phone, Blu-ray DVD player, flat-screen TV, two queen sized beds and a "living room" and a "bedroom". The hotel is about four or five blocks away from Lucas Oil Stadium. Our stay was wonderful and we would absolutely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I Needed for my first trip to Indianapolis!”
Reviews.Author: jessberger1986
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are huge Colts fans from NJ. For our third anniversary, we decided to see a Colts game and make our way to Indianapolis. For once I wante to be surrounded by COLTS fans, and not attacked by other fans! I am the kind of person that checks trip advisor and other hotel reviews constantly leading up to the trip and I have to say that I was MORE than pleased with this hotel. We were pleasantly welcomed and our room was facing the stadium. Pictures don't give justice as to how close you really are to the stadium. Our room was a queen bed studio and it was great! It's so convenient to have a kitchen in the room, even when you think you won't need it. There is a little bit of construction going on around town since the stadium is hosting the Super Bowl in 2012, but it wasn't too bad. We didn't rent a car, so we took the Go Indy Shuttle for $7 each way and it stopped right outside our hotel and runs every 20 minutes! You are just slightly displaced from central downtown, but I really thought it would be worse than it was. It was just about 3 blocks away from the hustle and bustle of downtown (which is nothing to someone who is used to NYC). Come gameday, ANYONE would love to be in our position and have our hotel that close. We practically walked out of the stadium, across the street, and we were back. It was so fun to see everyone up bright and early setting up tailgates and such! We never get to see Colts tailgating back in Jersey. Overall, the hotel was AMAZING. Location was great and staff was great. They have a hot breakfast every morning and it was delicious. They also have a wonderful indoor swimming pool, fitness center, and a home movie theatre (which was great when you came back from the game...we saw ppl in there watching game highlights). I plan on comming to Indy every year now for a game and I wouldn't say anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: rshelander
Reviews.Content: New experience. Very couteous and professional staff. Very attentive. Rooms were very nice and well appointed. Good breakfast as well

Reviews.Title: “Had Everything!”
Reviews.Author: SnR41010
Reviews.Content: So before deciding on the hotel, the reviews are what pushed me into actually booking my stay here. Although a lot of the reviews mentioned that nothing was in walking distance, such as food, or attraction....WELL I say WRONG, Great location, little less than a mile from the Mall, Steak N Shake, a gas station, bars/grill....and so on...My husband and I aren't the fittest people and the walk to all the those places, were short and pleasant. If we took a taxi it was because it was to dark and we were a little tipsy. The cab fare was around 6-9 bucks depending on what taxi company you went with. The Complimentary breakfast was great! Eggs, bacon, biscuit and gravy, muffins, cereal, toast, french toast, fresh fruit and more. The Pool/ Hot tub was nice a little smaller than other hotels but very quaint and clean, nice outside patio attached to the indoor pool. Gym was perfect! Oh and they have a laundry room free of charge to use! They had a mini store next to the desk where you could buy things, and the laundry detergent was a dollar. Our room was pretty big considering what our friends paid at other hotels downtown. What was even more great about it...was the mini kitchen. Had everything a kitchen at home would except smaller. The room was very contemporary, it was a mini suite, hence the name StayBridge suites. Amazing view of the Lucas Oil Stadium, literally right next to the place. Oh, one last note. The mall was big, had a great arcade, had a movie theater, plenty of food in their food court, and many nice shops. If you get a chance go to Howl at the Moon, a very great bar full of customer interaction. That to is in walking distance, although took a cab fare was 8 bucks there and back. Oh, and eat at Steak N Shake! It was yummy and cheap. $4.00 for a whole meal. Also Broad Ripple was about 15-20 min out from downtown, but had a blast there, bar hopping is great there, although Land Sharks bar was the BEST! On the other note, drinks/food were a little more pricey than my home city, and parking if you were to get a rental car such as our friends did your looking at between $18-20 dollars every where down town, even at your hotels. So I suggest walking or cab-in around town.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TanTin675
Reviews.Content: Our trip was great from beginning to end. It was better than the fancy five star hotels. It had more to offer. There is not one single that I could complain about. I will be using youur place of business more often. Leslie was very pleasant and accommodating. Natalie Tinker-Kinslow

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: 7MileGMa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to see my nephew race in the collegiate cycling track nationals at Major Taylor Velodrome. We arrived early due to a break in racing and were pleasantly surprised that we could check in early. Our extended family booked 6 rooms under 4 different last names and the staff was able to give us rooms on the same floor near each other without us asking them to. When my niece locked herself out of her room they asked a few questions to verify who she was then quickly issued her a new card. Great service! Nice and clean rooms. We had a queen and it was huge. The 2 room suites were great for those who went to bed early. The pool and spa were great. The breakfast area got very crowded in the morning but they tried very hard to keep the food flowing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Meld2323
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our trip to Indianapolis to see the "Manning Bowl". What a great hotel! Everyone was so nice and accommodating. Check in was a breeze. It is clean, spacious and very inviting. They have a small theatre screening room with big comfy leather chairs. Perfect to watch the game highlights or sit back and watch a movie. They also have a pool. I did not use it, but it looked very nice and it stays open until 11pm! Our room was perfect for our needs. It was a studio and was quite spacious. the kitchenette is a nice touch. It allowed us to keep some beverages in the refrigerator and heat up our leftovers from our terrific dinner from the nite before. The shower was one of the best in my opinion. We both took extra long showers...the water pressure was perfect and the shower has the extended shower rod so you don't feel cramped while showering. If you attending a game at Lucas Oil Stadium...this is def the hotel. It is directly across the street and they allow tailgating in their parking lot! What could be better? The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the city center, where there are tons of restaurants and a huge mall. If you are not renting a car, i suggest you take the local shuttle to and from the airport. It's called the "Greenline Shuttle". This only costs $7 per person as opposed to paying roughly $40 by taxi. The shuttle drops you off directly across the street from the hotel and runs about every 20 min. I highly recommend this. Will save you $$ as well as get a little tour of center city, as the Staybridge is the last stop. Good news is, on the way back to the airport, it's only a 10-15 min ride! All in all this was a great hotel, and I will def. come back!

Reviews.Title: “Wnderful Place”
Reviews.Author: hikling
Reviews.Content: Was here for a whole week during a convention could not have asked for a better place or value, rooms were spacious and clean, staff was friendly knowedeable of their city, and attentive, breakfast was good and nutrious, shuttle service was excellant. Used the pool the laundry and the office center all were excellant. I just can't say enough good about this place. Must make special mention of Skip , and Judy who frequently drove the shuttle , and evening clerk Katie who was always very helpful. The shuttle drivers managed to find us even when we wern't sure where we were. This is a great place and I will look for a staybridge every where I go.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly lovely!”
Reviews.Author: JudiCrawfordsville
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for two reasons: #1: They said they had smoking rooms (which are VERY difficult to come by in Indy) and #2: It is walking distance to White River State Park where my friend and I were to attend a concert. Some time ago I booked a room through Hotels.com which was supposed to be "smoking", only to be told upon arrival that it was a total non-smoking facility, so I was extrememly pleased to find ashtrays in our rooms. My only regret was that we only were able to stay one night; the suite was lovely; two flat screen TV's, full kitchen with everything one would need to cook meals (which we didn't have time to use) and the bathroom was very nice. Everything was extremely clean (I couldn't even tell we were on the "smoking" floor"), comfortable and the staff was gracious. We did take advantaqge of the free breakfast, and is was fine as those go- enough to get us going on our way. Parking was also very convenient and I felt safe the entire time- unlike other stays in Indianapolis. (I'm a country girl). The indoor pool looked nice though we didn't have time to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...and quality”
Reviews.Author: Nudgra
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the city center location for the Drum Corps International finals at Lucas OIl Stadium for three nights The location cannot be topped in that it is an easy walk across the street to the stadium Parking was adequate and reasonable. Room quality was supurb. the room came with a kitchenette with full size referigerator., built in microave and dishwasher. It also came with all the china and utensils to prepare a full meal , if desired. Room came with two flat screen tv's with HD service, one with a DVD . Sitting room had a pull out sofabed . bedroom had an extremely comfy king bed. Room was immaculately clean. A free breakfast was provided, and was far better than your average continental fare. there was meat and potatoes every day . fresh coffee and juices as well as the usual bagels and donuts . Checkin was effortless and the staff was friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel features...bad customer service experience”
Reviews.Author: jessz1717
Reviews.Content: At first glance this hotel was very nice looking although it is around a very industrial part of the very south point of the city. Upon check in the desk staff told me that for some reason my reservation did not go through on my credit card and that they would have to charge me the normal room price which is $30 more a night compared to the early booking price. After telling them that this was impossible they said they would take it down but still not as low as the price for early booking. When stating I would not stay for that price, they finally said they would take care of it for me and reduce it to what it was supposed to be, but that next time "I should call to make sure everything is okay". Like I'm supposed to know THEY had an issue with my credit card? After checking in we got to see the room and it was very nice and roomy. The bed was very comfortable and the suite like room is a lot nicer than an average hotel. We did have some bugs/ants in the bathroom, and the blanket smelled not very clean. The breakfast in the morning is okay; Average consiting of egg substitute ,sausage, toast and other small items. I did not appriciate having to pay $10 a night to park and then having to park my car down the street in a parking garage becuase the back lot was full. I was woken up several times in the night to people screaming and yelling in the middle of the night in a surrounding room as well as the very loud fridge kicking on. As we walked in to our room one night from the parking garage down the street, there was a very large group loitering and horseplaying in the drop off zone/ main entrance of the hotel while the desk staff sat outside, smoked and watched them be disruptive. It was a nice hotel, and I am very dissapointed to have had such a horrible experience there with staff and other things lacking. I went to school in Indianpolis and come down often to visit friends, but unfortunatly we will NOT be staying here again. Althought it was a good value in comparrasion to other hotels in the down town area, the reasons are shown by the time you leave your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - built in an industrial park”
Reviews.Author: Waterskier1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge downtown for 5 nights. The hotel was very clean and the front desk staff were great. Rooms are very comfortable with small kitchenets. Self serve breakfast was O.K...mostly continental with a couple of hot items. The location is in an industrial part of downtown on the south side of the Amtrak line and there is a power generating station between the hotel and downtown proper...a little sketchy walking to downtown at night. Parking is $10/day for an outdoor lot behind the hotel, which wasn't explained when we registered...I found out when it showed up on the Visa. Overall, a good hotel, but not quite downtown. Check Google Earth to see the surroundings. It would be perfect if you are going to the Colts game, the stadium is one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with great Staff”
Reviews.Author: hmeers3
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the Indy 500 weekend and it was extremely comfortable. It was perfect for a big family group. The hotel was very polite and the hotel was new and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and new - just wish it cost a little less”
Reviews.Author: gparch
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in for a while. The comforter helped me get to sleep. It's very quiet even though it's next to the new football stadium. The price was reasonable compared to others I checked but it could have been a little less IMO. The internet connection worked well - they have wired and wireless. The place was basically spotless. Breakfast was disappointing but it usually is at these type of places where it's included. this is very convenient to downtown. I was surprised that the staff would only extend my checkout from 11 AM to noon - they could have given me more time, especially since I am a Priority Club member. overall, would recommend. I was also surprised that I had to pay $10 for parking in an open air lot behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Capelle
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, from the UK using the chain's online system, on the strength of the positive reviews we'd read here, and we were not disappointed. In fact, for our purposes we thought it was excellent. It's a new building - opened in 2008 - and it shows: every is pretty much unmarked and shiny-new. We had a one-room suite and thought it was great. Both the bedroom and lounge were of ample size and in addition there was a well-equipped kitchen with microwave, two-plate stove, dishwasher and a full-sized fridge. It was well-supplied with plates, utensils, etc. There were two, digital, flat-screen tvs, one in the lounge, one in the bedroom. Beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was fine. There was central, quiet, airconditioning. We stayed 3 nights and, happily, these coincided with the "Manager's Specials", which provide complimentary buffet food and drink (including beer and wine). The laundry room, with washers and driers, is also complimentary (we used it, and it worked fine). You don't get full room service, in fact it pretty much amounts to emptying the rubbish cans and changing the bathroom towels (if you want), but this was fine with us. If I've any negatives, it would have to be the $10/day charged for the open-lot parking at the rear of the hotel, and the fact that the hotel is quite a walk from downtown Indy - about 20 minutes. On the other hand, if you're a Cubs fan, the stadium looms large right across from the rear side of the hotel. We were extremely satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: bbharrison78
Reviews.Content: We had a great time! We were there for July 4. We brought our two small dogs. It was great because they did not charge for them. We would have had to bring them to the kennel which woud have been more than our room rate. We had an awful dinner at Forty Five Degrees (no fault to the hotel), so I was hungry when we got back to the room later that evening. Thank goodness for the 24 hour Bridgemart! Beef Jerky, Popcorn, Pop Tarts and Water and I was set! Great decor and great comfort. Thank you to all of the staff. The desk agent even has a Bischon like me! Kudos to a job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, great time!”
Reviews.Author: dentalhy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after the INDY 500. Very impressed by the cleanliness, I got the impression it was a new hotel. But I guess not, they sure fooled us! The front desk was very helpful in telling us how to find a shuttle service to the track. It was a short walk, albeit a bit unsafe along the highway at one point. The room was immaculate, the beds so comfortable. Just perfect after a long hot day. We were surprised that the breakfast, scheduled to end at 9:30; did end at 9:30. After all, it was a holiday weekend. The hotel was busy with race fans. The young woman who was cleaning was very abrupt in removing all items from the breakfast area, and shutting out the lights. I would think on a holiday weekend there might be some leniency considering the number of guests and situation. All in all, we would stay again. Close to downtown and great restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pdford07
Reviews.Content: Suite 2 bedroom 2 bath was super. 3 TV's, kitchen! The hotel even has an indoor movie theater, hot breakfast every morning and FREE LAUNDRY! after staying for 10 days it was like i never left home.

Reviews.Title: “Staybridge Suites Was Awesome”
Reviews.Author: sarahlouise2
Reviews.Content: We recently attended our first Indianapolis Colts game at the new Lucas Oil Stadium and chose the Staybridge because it's located across the street from the stadium. Upon check-in we were professionally greeted by the receptionist. She explained all the amenities that the hotel offered which included a complimentary hot breakfast buffet, free guest laundry, free high speed internet, BBQ pavilion and a home theatre room. The breakfast was exceptional with eggs, bacon, pastries, yogurt, fruit and they even had a waffle machine. The suites were spacious and comfortable and have full kitchens. I would definitely stay at the Indianapolis Downtown Staybridge Suites in my future trips there and would highly recommend this hotel to friends.

HotelInfo.Name: Staybridge Suites Indianapolis - City Centre
